intro: Mezia ita-uba, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Mezia ita-uba thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish.
